Potom sme slamovlasých utĺkli (heh heh heh). Ale nebyť nás silákov, stalo by sa z nás žrádlo pre červy!

I prevailed! I defeated them! But... one of them was so weak that he perished from the blows I dealt him. If he had been a simple bondsman, that would have been the end of it. But no. He was one of Great Lord Lurmsakun's many sons, by a lesser wife.

Well, you will not find any of Rohan or Dunland who will accept my claim, but it is a true one nonetheless. My grand-dam was a herdswoman, living in the hills, and one day it chanced that old King Fengel, the greedy grasping grandfather of Theoden the Pretender, happened to see her on the banks of the Isen. He took a fancy to her, and my dam was his child.

Do you not know before whom you stand? Ignorant fool. Know that I am Zigûrphel, of ancient Akallabêth - but like as not you know nothing of that name! Know, also, that I seek to redress the wrongs of long ago, the wrongs wrought upon me and my people by the spite of the Valar, they who sank our Great Armament and our home. Ah, Ar-Pharazôn, great and glorious! Shall your vision be unremembered evermore? No, not so long as Zigûrphel lives and has hands to do her work!

Narodila som sa do urodzenej rodiny a vykonávala som čestný úrad chyžnej Pani Éowyn už od detských čias. Naši otcovia boli natoľko prezieraví, že nám dovolili cvičiť sa v umení boja po boku našich bratov, aby sme sa stali štítonoškami Rohanu.
Pán Elrond ma posiela ako svojho veľvyslanca za Pánom Celebornom, aby mu poskytol radu potrebnú v čase Vojny v tejto časti Rhovanionu.

Rád kráčam skrytími chodníčkami v našom čarokrásnom lese. Niekedy ticho prechádzam pod stromami pozorujúc divokú zver hvozdu. Štebot vzácneho vtáka či pozorovanie ukladanie diviakov na odpočinok je pre mňa rovnakým potešením, ako rinčanie čepelí a pohľad na veľké steny pre Edainov.
Pomáhal som vylepšiť a vystužiť obranu Ereboru a vycvičil som tiež pár mladých trpasličích pobratimov pod dohľadom môjho cteného otca Dwalina, ako je naším obyčajom.
Vyliečil som Kráľa Branda zo zápchy, nevoľnosťou príznačnou pre mužov idúcich na vojnu. Stačí ľahký odvar z paliny a obe črevá sa uvoľnia, rovnako aj myseľ dôjde pokoja.

Takže som si povedal, ´Gulm, chceš sa stať zdochlinou?´ a odvetil som, ´Nie´.^Hneď v ďalšom boji som sa zvalil k zemi, akoby ma ranili. Potom, keď sa nik nedíval, skočil som po vodcovi! Rozťal som ho takmer na polovicu, gharr! Potom som čisto prebodol jeho sluhu snagu^^...Ukázalo sa, že ten krpatý podlizovač prežil a začal o tom jazyčiť. Nabudúce mu rovno useknem hlavu, gharr...
Som Vrrčí Jazdec a stopár z Isengardu.

And so here I am, cursed at and spit upon, condemned to die for being mightier than the dogs who mock me! Free me, Great One. Free me, speak for me - and my strength is yours. My blade is yours. My life is yours!

Naturally, Chief Daeglaf and the rest wish to give me no chance at all for glory, for if I were to perform great deeds in battle, it would lend wings to my claim. Men would flock to my banner then! Your fame runs before you, Commander. If you will allow me to serve under your banner, I can perform those great deeds for you.

O Akallabêth, where are you now? Faded, all faded away... Where there once was light, the glory of our nation that was great above all others, now there is only the Shadow. My beautiful home now knows the eternal silence of the sea. But my heart is still full of fire, and dark beasts run wild within it. I know potent arts that you and your kind have never even imagined. Hearken unto me, now! Will you beg for my aid, as you should, or will you go from here skulking, like a worm? Choose swiftly!

Mal by si vedieť že ženy, akokoľvek skúsené, nesmú jazdiť s éoredmi. Ale stojím si za tým, že čakanie pri krbe na návrat vojakov nie je môj osud. Nebudem nečinne sedieť dokiaľ je v tejto Vojne stále čas na veľké činy a rada by som ich dosiahla po tvojom boku, bojovník.
Ale dokiaľ sú nepriatelia Lothlórienu na úprku môžem sa k tebe na chvíľu pridať, {playername}. Cítim, že naše osudy sú v tejto Vojne prepletené.
Vydiac ťa ustrojeného na vojnu si myslím, že by si to nepochopil. Ale musel si cestovať mnohými krajmi - povedz, videl si aj iné šíre hvozdy? Mohol by si ma k ním vziať?

Bojovanie v sebe nesie nápev pokoja, ktorý sa nehodí k trpasličiemu bojovníkovi môjho pôvodu a povahy. Domnievam sa, že na cestách si toho užijete omnoho viac a že tvoja vec je blízka záujmom trpaslíkov, že? Azda nemusím hovoriť, že bojovný trpaslík výrazne navýši vašu nádej na prežitie.

Dopočul som sa, že sa veľké boje odohrávajú inde a naše zeme sú od nich našťastie ušetrené. Súdiac podľa škrabancov na tvojom brnení usudzujem, že si sa často krát vrhol v ústrety smrteľnému nebezpečenstvu. Možno moje skromné schopnosti lepšie využiješ vo svojej družine pre vyššie dobre všetkých.

Som bojový Uruk-hai, berserk! Čo sa dá vedieť o kynožení ľudí, to viem. Slúžil som Bielej Ruke, ale tá by ma teraz najradšej uvrhla do pekelných dier.^^Radšej by som sa s tebou vybral loviť ľudí na juh, zatiaľ čo budú snagy škripotať zubami v Isengarde.
Možno by si mohol byť mojím novým vodcom.

I have been fortunate, I suppose, that Great Lord Lurmsakun has been occupied elsewhere. His intendants have left me here to rot. But my destiny is not to die as a prisoner! Have you come to grant me my rightful death on the battlefield?
Ho there! You have returned, as I knew you would. My hands are kept idle by my jealous chiefs. Let us speak, Commander! I would follow you, and fight in your ranks to win for myself renown.

You trouble my dreams still! Will you give me no peace? My dreaming eye sees deep and far. Here in Dol Guldur I still have visions of your works. I say this: if you were wise, you would have asked for my aid again ere now.
Viacero jazdcov dorazí s početnými zraneniami na tele, snažím sa im poskytnúť tú najlepšiu starostlivosť. Ale stále sa cítim byť uviaznutý v kleci.
Už si sa rozmyslel? Čas Eldarov sa kráti.
Niekoľko dní som sledoval skrýšu obrovských pavúkov. Odporné tvory, ale aspoň držia votrelcov ďaleko. Prišiel si ma požiadať, či by som sa vybral na cesty s tebou?
Budovanie obrany zvládne každý trpaslík. Ale ja potrebujem nájsť prácičku i pre svoju sekeru. A to čo najskôr. Ber ma so sebou.
Znova som navštívil Kráľa, tentokrát pre zvracanie. Dúfam, že jeho pokus o zápas s nepriateľmi nedopadne rovnako, ako jeho zdravie. Netrpíš náhodou aj ty zápchou či zvracaním?
Čo si myslíš, že by som asi tak porába? Gulm tu sedí a čaká, než ho nejaká plíživá snaga zapíchne v tme do chrbta. Ber ma s sebou - poslúžim ti dobre.
Už si sa rozmyslel? Poslúžim dobre.
If you are truly as ferocious as you look, perhaps you could fight for me. After we feed you up a bit, of course.
Very well. As long as you can fight in the battle line, you can be of use, Dunlending.
Strange way of asking to join me, witch. But very well, you may come along.
Bolo by trúfalé to odo mňa žiadať, ale určite by sa mi zišli tvoje schopnosti v nadchádzajúcich bojoch.
Cestujeme po svete aby sme uchránili všetko čisté. Prinášame nepriateľom boj.
Samozrejme, pre trpasličieho bojovníka mám vo svojej družine miesto.
Zišiel by sa nám liečiteľ a bylinkár.
Hádam si nechám berserka prekĺznuť pomedzi paprče.
Pah! A murderous pit dog is not fit to be a companion of mine.
You talk of great deeds. Go and do some of your own, before you approach me again!
Pah! I'm guessing your bark is far worse than your bite. I have work to do!
Prepáčte, moja Pani, ale nič s tým nezmôžem.
Vrátim sa, keď nebude Lothlórienu hroziť také nebezpečenstvo.
Nie, je mi ľúto. Navštevujeme liečiteľov, len ak ich nám je treba.
Oh, to sink my teeth into meat again! You'll see my true mettle soon enough, once my hands and feet are free, and I have food in my belly!

Yes, you may call me that for now, for I am not ashamed of my Dunlending blood. My people have suffered greatly under the tyrant kings of Rohan, and I feel no small kinship with them. I will aid you in this war, and in all your efforts. But in return, Commander, you must help me press my claim when the time comes.

I will overlook your haughtiness for a time, but know that someday we shall have words. Perhaps by then, we shall both be standing before the Dark Lord, whom I once knew by a much different name, and then we shall see who has his ear. Perhaps then I shall teach you manners.
To je veľkorysá ponuka, môžeš ma privítať vo svojej družine, veliteľ.
Chápem. Priznávam, že sa ku mne už dostali zvesti o tvojich činoch.
Nenávidím násilie a nástroje vojny, ale viem ako sa brániť v zhone.

Som skúsený so sekerou v boji na blízku ale aj v hádzaní. Taktiež ti môžem zaistiť nízke poplatky ak ma necháš sa porozprávať s obchodníkmi. A mám aj očko na hľadanie tej najlepšej koristi z padlých nepriateľov na bojisku.
Vskutku? Dobre teda, iba si zhromaždím svoje bylinky a recepty.
Bojujúci Uruk je cennejší ako všetky tvoje snagy. Bojujúci Uruk nikdy neuteká z boja.
Vážne? Urobil by si dobre ak by si ma zapísal.
My mother once told me, I was born to hew many foemen. For you, I will slay many soft weaklings of the West. Only put a good blade into my hands, and I will do the rest!

I fight as my people do, like wolves in the night - I may fling a spear, or drive a pike into the chest of a charging horseman. Limbs I hew with axe or sword. With you, I will speak openly: I care not if you give more service to the Eye or the White Hand. It is all one to me, as long as I can sit my rightful throne in the Golden Hall.

But for now, let my lore and craft founded in long years be yoked to your service. Know this: with Zigûrphel's aid, you are as a dragon given its wings in the pit of Utumno. Great things I will do for you and your purpose, though you comprehend them not!
Pravidelne som trénoval streľbu lukom a lovil som oštepom. A pod tvojim velením povediem lov i na ohyzdov. Tiež sa trochu vyznám v liečiteľstve, v dnešných časoch tak potrebnom.
Možno ak sa pripojím k tvojej družine a nepriateľovi uštedríme nečakané a prudké útoky, jeho rozhodnosť zakolíše. Pôjdem.
Možno ťa môžem naučiť pohybovať sa rýchlejšie a zároveň robiť menej hluku. Poďme.
Ak dokážeš udržať tých hromtĺkov z tvojej družiny, aby načúvali tvojim rozkazom, hlavne tých záludných Elfov, veľmi rád sa pridám.
Musím ťa však varovať, že je mi umenie boja cudzie. Verím však, že dokážeš udržať ženu môjho veku v bezpečí.
Musíš sa rozhodnúť rýchlo, stráže začínajú byť podozrievavé.
Nebudeš ľutovať, že si ma vzal so sebou.
I like your spirit. Very well, I will send word to Lurmsakun on your behalf.
Well, then, 'Prince', take up your weapons. You fight for me, now.
I hope, for your sake, that your words are not idle boasting. Do not disappoint me, Zigûrphel.
Pôsobivé. Sme pripravení vyraziť kedykoľvek vám to príde vhod, moja Pani.
Bolo by nám cťou byť v spoločnosti Elfského lorda.
Tak dobre. Dúfam že neutečieš od prvého ohyzda, ktorého stretneme.
Tak dobre, Majster Trpaslík, môžete sa pridať.
S nami budete v bezpečí, sľubujem. Čoskoro odchádzame.
Tak dobre. Ak budeš robiť ako hovorím, budeš aj dobre jesť.
Your are fierce... perhaps too fierce. A little more time in the stocks for now might teach you obedience.
You shall have to sit on these bales of hay for a little longer, 'Prince'.
Your brag and abuse grate upon my ears. Tame your tongue before we speak again!
Ospravedlňujem sa, moja Paní, možno nabudúce.
Avšak na druhú stranu by sme sa asi mali Lothlórienu snažiť pomôcť vlastnými silami.
Prepáč, ale neviem si ťa predstaviť na bojisku.
Je mi to ľúto, všetci bojujú v mojej spoločnosti.
Prehodnotil som svoje stanovisko. Ktokoľvek by ťa vyhľadával, môže rovno začať stopovať aj mňa.
Surely, a mighty commander of your stature has only but to say the word, and they will release me. [costs {reg14} Influence with {s14}]
It seems Daeglaf the Black may seek some excuse to hold me here, Commander. [costs {reg14} Influence with {s14}]
Rather, it is you who would do well not to disappoint me or the Master we both serve. Have you done well enough in his estimation? [costs {reg14} Influence with {s14}]
Pripojil by som sa k tebe, ale kto sa postará o zranených, ak bude mesto napadnuté? [stojí {reg14} vplyvu s {s14}]
Čoskoro by sme mali vyraziť. Cena môjho úsilia príde vnivoč, ak Nepriateľ vycíti moju prítomnosť ešte predtým, než naň udrieme. Ale Lotlórien ma taktiež potrebuje. [stojí {reg14} vplyvu s {s14}]
Pridal by som sa k tebe, ale povinnosť mi káže ostať tu. [stojí {reg14} vplyvu s {s14}]
Pridám sa k tebe, ale obávam sa, že pre to nebude mať môj ctihodný otec Dwalin veľké pochopenie. [stojí {reg14} vplyvu s {s14}]
Nemôžem tu zanechať všetky povinnosti, môj kráľ ma stále potrebuje. Trápi ma bezútešný stav jeho zdravia. [stojí {reg14} vplyvu s {s14}]
Chcel by som s tebou odísť, ale stráže pri bráne ma nenechajú odísť.^Ver mi, už som to skúšala. [stojí {reg14} vplyvu s {s14}]
Pridal by som sa k tebe, ale povinnosť mi káže ostať tu. [stojí {reg14} vplyvu s {s14}]
No doubt of that. Lurmsakun's subordinates will not dare refuse me. [costs {reg14}/{reg15} Influence]
Chief Daeglaf will have to give way before my wish, once I make it plain. [costs {reg14}/{reg15} Influence]
Indeed I have. Come now! It is not, after all, a lowly snaga you will follow. [costs {reg14}/{reg15} Influence]
Je to šľachetný dôvod, ale som si istý, že sa tu nájde náhrada. [stojí {reg14}/{reg15} vplyvu]
Ver mi, mne budeš omnoho užitočnejší. [stojí {reg14}/{reg15} vplyvu]
Od teraz a navždy, tvoja povinnosť je pri mne. [stojí {reg14}/{reg15} vplyvu]
Majster Dwalin určite pochopí, že bojaschopný trpaslík by nemal šetriť svojimi silami pred našimi nepriateľmi príliš dlho. [stojí {reg14}/{reg15} vplyvu]
Kráľovo zdravie je dôležité, ale so mnou sa ti podarí zachrániť viac životov. [stojí {reg14}/{reg15} vplyvu]
Oh, ale stráž sa ťa neodváži ani dotknúť, ak pôjdeš v mojom sprievode. [stojí {reg14}/{reg15} vplyvu]
Od teraz a navždy, tvoja povinnosť je pri mne. [stojí {reg14}/{reg15} vplyvu]
Great One! My thirst for blood is unslaked! Why do we {s21}, like cowards? Let me fight them!
Commander, I mislike it greatly that we {s21}. A king like myself should ever be open-handed, but if the larders are empty I have nothing to give, and our soldiers will desert us.
I would say I had expected better of you, Commander, but that would be a lie. Beware, lest your self-serving ways do harm to the lofty designs of your betters!
Nevšímaj si, čo hovoria ostatní vojaci, ale niekedy {s21} je tá najmúdrejšia voľba. A ja napríklad oceňujem všetky tie ušetrené zlomeniny, čoby šancu bojovať v iné dni, kedy sa od nás osud neodvráti.
Musíš zvážiť svoje rozhodnutia, veliteľ. {s21} znamená, že nie sme o nič lepší, než nepriateľ, a to podráža sebavedomie naše aj našich priateľov.

Nie som nadšený z toho, že si rozkázal {s21}. Padnúť v boji je poctou pre každého ozajstného trpaslíka, ale bojovať v družine vedenej zbabelcom je potupa. Čo by na to povedali moji bratranci, ak by s to dozvedeli?
Veliteľ, musím namietať. {s21} je pre našich mužov tvrdé a nežiadúce. Robím čo môžem, aby som uľahčil ich trápenia, ale prosím, nedopusť sa ďalšej zásadnej chyby.
Uruk-hai nepoznajú rozkaz {s21}. Pánko má zrejme strachom scvrknuté vnútornosti, asi ti od nich jednej noci uľahčím. Gulm prehovoril.
I joined you not to {s21}, Great One, but to bathe in the blood of our foes! You may employ your guile for now, but give me a good slaughter soon, I beg you!

Ah, our mighty Commander. Great deeds you performed, you say? I wonder how many other of your battles ended this way, with you advancing recklessly into the jaws of a trap, and fleeing with as much haste.
No dovoľte, veliteľ. Ženy môjho postavenia rády príjmu smrť, ale rozhodne nie hanbu na bojovom poli. {s21} znamená potupu môjho rodu i predkov.

Great One, if you value Varfang as a warrior, I beg that you keep him as far away from me as possible. I have already warned him that his hands must not go where I will not let them, or I shall chop them off and feed them to his horse.

Commander, I wonder greatly that you retain the services of a lowly creature like Ufthak. Of course, the orc-kind are scum and arrow-shields for our true warriors, but he stalks around the camp giving orders to man and orc alike, as if he were one with authority. I hope you do not miss him too greatly if I slay him. Or perhaps I will simply cleave off the end of his ugly nose.

The Southron Lykyada should learn manners, and be taught humility. Insolent is his tongue, and overproud his bearing! I care not that he is a captain among his men - a foolish lesser race they are, in any case, slow to recognise greatness or bow to their betters as they should! If he knew but a small part of what I could do to him...
{playername}, práve som videl {s11}a, ako zadupal hniezdo mladých vtákov. Jeho nešikovnosť zmarila životy nevinných tvoroch.

Pán {s11} si vedie v boji dobre, ale začínam mať podozrenie, že všetkých svojich nepriateľov zaslepuje ligotom svojich vlasov. Alebo žeby pred ním padali sami v úžase pred jeho slávou a panovačným vystupovaním?
Veliteľ, musím vás uvedomiť o sťažnosti na {s11}a. Neustále sa vôkol mňa obšmieta a chce, aby som mu pripravil istý druh piva, ktorému hovorí 'zelená víla'.

Great One, I wish to ask, what is the blood price you have set on Varfang's head? If it happens that I kill or maim him, I would pay it to you as recompense. He was leering at me after that battle, licking his foul lips. If he looks at me that way again, I'll carve his eyeballs out and feed them to him.

As I expected, the cowardly orc calling himself Ufthak is of little worth in battle. He skulks behind the line, doing but little to aid his fellows. Your cause - and my fight for my throne - will not be helped overmuch by his kind, I think.

If Lykyada's hands were not of such use to us, Commander, I should remove them from his arms. You know that I am in the habit of walking among our fallen foes after a battle - there is great power in the fear and pain of the dying for one who has the art to use it, though none of you have the knowing of it. Yet he, that swarthy Southron, stalks around giving the gift of a swift death to those whose hurts are too deep for capture. That grain of mercy in his heart prevented me from basking in the death-glow of the fallen! How important is his precious honour to you, I wonder?
Tie jeho trpasličie spôsoby mu zrejme slúžia pod zemou dobre, hoci je na podiv, že sa ešte neprepadol nejakou šachtou. Možno by mal.
Vodilo by sa nám lepšie s trpasličím hrdinom, niekoho ako bol Durin Nesmrteľný za dávnych čias, a nechať elfov, nech si poskakujú lesmi.

Je to vyrobené z paliny presiaknutej likérom a obľúbené medzi trubadúrmi a pocestnými, ktorí sa radi nechávajú obklopiť bludmi, aké nie sú skutočné. Nemyslím, že by sa ti páčilo sledovať svojich mužov na bojovom poli, ako sa oháňajú za vzduchom, i keď by to mohol byť ozaj zábavný výjav.

Gulm is not only a treacherous beast, Great One - he is proud of being one. He was telling us his story again around the campfire last night, and boasting of his foul deed. You would do well to watch that creature, Great One. If he could betray his commanders when serving the White Hand, what's to stop him from doing the same with you?

Every time I set eyes upon Fuldimir, a nameless rage within me rises. No, no, it is nothing he has done. But he and his people, the sea-dogs of Umbar, are most unworthy of their blood. They dare call themselves heirs of ancient Anadûnê - but of course, they say 'Númenor', not knowing any better. Why, I would suppose that barely a drop of the true blood is to be found in Fuldimir's veins! Perhaps, if you can spare him, I could find out for myself...
Pekný kus šrotu, že, kapitán? I keď ho trochu znehodnotili čachre machre tej elfskej ženy menom {s11}.

That misshapen creature Gulm had better guard his neck, or I'll slice through it! I was about to slay a foe, but he stepped in front of me and made the kill that should have been mine. Then he had the gall to turn around and sneer at me! He and his kind had better remember that they were bred to serve us! Honourless curs.

He cannot possibly be one of us. No, not one like Fuldimir. No, our blood cannot have thinned so much, our line cannot have fallen so far! Do none of you mark how little he speaks of the true speech, how in appearance he is much more like unto those of Haradwaith than of my lost home? We had heroes among us - heroes, who fought with swiftness and strength to rival the Eldar! Fuldimir is slow, and clumsy, and... No, I feel the cold wind blowing out of the West. It chills me... it chills me!

Videl som ju, ako nás kryla z tylu; jeden či dva razy sa jej dokonca podarilo vystreliť smerom k nepriateľovi. Tvrdím, že by bolo lepšie nechať ju ísť, nech sa stará o vtáčky a včelstvo, a my zas pôjdeme a budeme bojovať s nepriateľmi, ako sme to robili doteraz.

Great One, do you mark how deadly Lykyada is in battle? How swift his arrows, how sharp his blade! With your permission, Great One, I should like to spend more time training under his tutelage. He has much he could teach me that could make me more useful to you.

The joy of battle sings in my blood! And in Varfang's too, I can see. The man is a terror to behold on the battlefield, laughing as he rides down the worthless foes who flee. These men from the East intrigue me, Commander. We could learn much of horsemanship from them, if the Rohirrim will not teach the Dunlendings after I come into my own.

Behold Bolzog. Bolzog the Great! See how he scurries with his bow-legged gait, coming and going at my whim, doing everything I ask of him. Just as a proper little 'urku' should, I say. I quite like him, Commander. Bolzog! Bring me the unguent! Now!
Hrdinsky vybojovaná bitka, veliteľ, blahoželám k víťazstvu. Všimol som si, ako sa {s11} vysporiadal aj so zranenými a neduživými, aby aj posledný z nepriateľov dostal to, čo si zaslúžil.

Great One, it speaks well of you that a warrior like Lykyada fights under your banner. I had thought all Southerners weak and decadent, not so different from the men of the West, but if they have more like him among their ranks, then the days of the West are indeed coming to an end.

Commander, Varfang and I were sharing a skin of wine around the campfires last night. Deep-counselled I deem him, for ever mindful is he of the deeds of his forebears, as one should be. I know not if, as he says, the spirits of our ancestors are with us. Indeed, I like not the thought. But a king must know the story of his blood, of mothers and fathers aforetimes. Varfang is one such who knows this.

I have never met an 'urku' quite like Bolzog. Oh, I grant you he is unlovely to look upon, but in all my long years he is the first one I've ever encountered who can do more than simply sneak, skulk and slaughter. His gnarled hands are surprisingly deft. Yes, so surprisingly deft... It may be that he can learn more of the arts of bone and sinew than I had reckoned at first.
Ušetrenie života je ten najcnostnejší čin, a s takou dušou sa cítim v príbuzenstve, aj ak sú naše kraje navzájom svetom vzdialené.
Zaujímalo by ma, aký je vlastne starý. Možno o tucet storočí starší, než ja? To nič, nerozumel by si tomu.

Ah, the Anduin. Great One, you will have heard of the great victories of the Wainriders many generations ago? They made an alliance with us Variags, and together our warriors crushed the pitiful armies of Gondor, under the king they called Ondoher. What a glorious slaughter our forefathers must have enjoyed!

Ah, Edoras. My rightful seat. Look up there, Commander, at the Golden Hall. Only a few generations ago, it was at the very doors of Meduseld that the last son of Helm Hammerhand was slain, and thereafter Wulf was King, for a time. Not the Wulf who is a Chief of Dunland now, of course - that one is a mere mongrel bearing the name of a greater creature.

Ah, the Lonely Mountain. The last bastion of Durin's Folk, is it not, in these latter days? It is pleasant to see it with my own eyes at last. Pleasant, yes... but not as pleasant as the memory of that Dwarf's dying moments, which I made longer with my arts. Hardy are the Dwarfs, indeed! Yet Aulë the Maker did them no favours in making them so capable of suffering.
Zastavme sa tu na chvíľu, veliteľ. Pred nami, medzi riekou Anduinou a Lipavou, leží pole Celebrant, kde dávno Eorl Mladý pomohol Gondoru odraziť vo veľkej bitke spoločného nepriateľa.
Daro! Tamto pred nami je Angrenost a čierna veža Orthanc. Mnoho sa zmenilo od doby, kedy som ich zočil naposledy, ale nič k lepšiemu.
Veliteľ, na slovíčko. Cesty v tejto časti lesa sú zakalené mnohým zlom a niektoré dokonca vedú naslepo. Musíme sa približovať k pevnosti Dol Guldur.

Hej, kapitán! Toto musí byť stará cesta k Východným Bránam Khazad-dûmu, alebo Morii, ako si už rozhodne počul. V diaľave je vidieť lesk jazera Kheled-zâram, a cez oblaky tri vrcholy týčiace sa nad touto časťou Hmlových Hôr
Oh, aký to pohľad! Neraz som začul príbehy o tomto mieste, kde statní lesníci žijú v harmónií so zverov i kvetenou. Grizlovci sa im hovorí, ak mi pamäť slúži.
Hrom do toho! Tamtá pevnosť, to musí byť určite Helmov žľab, pane.

Our wise ones told us all about that war. If it hadn't been for the weakness of the Southerners, losing a battle they should have won, the Gondorians would never have won the Battle of the Camp. The chariots of the Wainriders were smashed, and many fierce heroes died in the swamps of the Dead Marshes.

I would see our peoples united, as they have been in the past. No more will women of dun hair nurse sickly babies at their bosoms, while their fair-haired cousins feast on meat and swoon from wine in warm halls. No more will the black-haired hill man look with resentment upon the herds of horses owned by a crofter with hair of gold. As king, I will see justice done - but first, let the tyrants of Rohan pay their weregild.

I remember him well - Thráin, son of Thrór. Foolhardy, vainglorious would-be scion of a broken line, claimant of a worthless throne! Great torment he endured at my hands. But no one withstands the will of Zigûrphel for long, Commander. No one. I took his Ring from him, in the dungeons of Dol Guldur, and sent it on to the Dark Tower for a great reward. High I rose then, in the Dark Lord's favour!

str_npc22_home_description|Kedysi bol vybudovaný Kráľovstvom na Juhu, dnes je však sídlom toho, komu sa hovorí Biely čarodej, ktorý spriada svoje osídla, aby navýšil svoju moc na úkor druhých.
str_npc23_home_description|Nikdy som nezašiel tak ďaleko, ale začul som našich Prieskumníkov z Temnohvozdu vravieť, že tu niekde možno obchádza kraj Nazgul. Pociťujem prítomnosť zla, niečoho skazeného, niečoho, čo nedokážem pomenovať. Je to ale mocné, radšej buďme pripravení.
str_npc24_home_description|Podľa všetkej tej spúšte a mnohých stôp po ohyzdoch sa obávam o osud statočného Balina a jeho výpravy. Vyzerá to, že Moria upadla v Tieň a mali by sme postupovať opatrne.
str_npc25_home_description|Nie príliš často, putujúci obchodník zavíta na dálsky trh a ponúka ten najlepší med, aký som kedy zakúsil. Z nejakého zvláštneho dôvodu vraví: 'ten je robený samými medveďmi,' a nato sa rozjarene rozosmeje.
str_npc26_home_description|Jeho prekliate hradby sú príliš vysoké a príliš silné na to, aby sa dali prelomiť. Hádam, že ak by sa nám aj podarilo odohnať ľudskú zberbu od toho ich chlieva, čo nazývajú Edoras, zdupkali by tam a schovali sa za jeho hrubé steny.
str_npc27_home_description|Poznáš to mesto?
; str_npc18_home_description_2|It pleases me to be marching with you, Great One. The leaders of my people will want to have this land again, which was once theirs. They may take as much as they like from Gondor and the West. For my part, if I can spill the blood of more enemies on this soil, I will count myself happy.
; str_npc19_home_description_2|You will speak for me, won't you, Commander, when the long war is over? To whichever Power holds sway over the other - Eye or Hand? You will lend your voice to my claim, that I may hold Edoras and all Rohan in fief to an overlord, as my home and holding?
; str_npc20_home_description_2|We shall crush the works of the Valar, of which these Dwarfs are a chief part, here in Middle-earth. Yes, it would be sweet to unmake what the Maker wrought. We will grind the Dwarves beneath our heels, shatter the last kingdoms of low Men, and laugh as the Elves fade into the mists like ghosts. Then the day will come when I stand before the Caves of the Forgotten, in Valinor, and call forth my king again!
str_npc21_home_description_2|Urobíme dobre, ak si budeme pripomínať a pamätať veľké obete i hrdinské činy, aké priniesli časy minulé. Spojenectvo medzi Rohanom a Gondorom opäť zachráni náš ľud od skazy.
str_npc22_home_description_2|Nech nám je varovaním to, že aj tí najmocnejší, dokonca aj jeden z Istari, dokáže byť skazený a podľahnúť temnote. Tí, čo prahnú po moci, dokážu byť porazený mocou samou, preto už neotáľajme.
str_npc23_home_description_2|Niečo mi hovorí, že sa temné vojská za jeho stenami pripravujú na pochod... Do krásneho Lothlórienu? Do Dolu? Do Zelenohvozdu, mojej domoviny? To nedokážem povedať, ale prosím, urob všetko, čo bude v tvojich silách, aby si ich zastavil.
str_npc24_home_description_2|Pokiaľ nás osudy vojny dovedú do čela veľkej armády, mali by sme podstúpiť to riziko a vydať sa Baní, aby sme znovuzískali to veľké bohatstvo, čo tam spočíva.
str_npc25_home_description_2|Cítim sladkú vôňu mnohých kvetov a vidím všade navôkol včely zvierajúce nektár. Ak by ti to nevadilo, pozbieral by som nejaké bylinky pre našu vlastnú potrebu, zaberie to len chvíľku.
str_npc26_home_description_2|Nemá cenu sa tu plahočiť o niečo dlhšie, ak nás nekryje veľká horda Uruk-haiov. Teda, pokiaľ sa si neprišiel grimasiť na stráže na hradbách.
str_npc27_home_description_2|Minas Morgul, kde sa Nazgúlovia nalievajú dňom i nocou, hrr-hrr!
; str_npc18_home_recap|I was a prisoner in stocks, condemned to die for slaying a son of Lurmsakun in the training pit. Three of them set upon me, and I beat them, but one died of his wounds. Then you spoke for me, and freed me. Now I kill for you, and I would die for you if need be.
; str_npc19_home_recap|I am of the royal blood of Rohan, I swear - King Fengel was my grandfather, though he never took my grandmother to wife. The Chiefs of Dunland are jealous of me, and kept me away from the fighting so I would do no great deeds, and win no glory nor men to my banner. Then you took my under your banner. Now I await the day I can sit in Edoras on my rightful throne.
; str_npc20_home_recap|What more is there to tell, Commander? I practised my arts in the dungeons of Dol Guldur. My dreaming eye sees deep and far, and I saw you and your works in this War. It would seem I must give you what aid I can, so that the powers of the West may fail and the Power in the East may rise once more and rule until the world's ending.
str_npc21_home_recap|Nepríde mi smiešne to, že by si mal zabudnúť tak skoro.

; str_gondor_guildmaster_companion_player_ask|By leave of the Lord of Gondor, I seek valiant confederates. Are there such in this place?
; str_gondor_guildmaster_companion_none|Nay, Commander. What valour we have is needed to defend our own walls. You may go to the barracks and find soldiers of courage and experience - mayhap more the former than the latter, I fear. Ever have we been traders, crafters and farmers. The finest of our soldiers go to the capital to enlist - perhaps you should try the White City.
; str_gondor_guildmaster_companion_player_none_ok|Very well. I thank you for your counsel.
; str_gondor_guildmaster_player_found_ok|I thank you. May the good will of all good people go with you.
; str_gondor_mt_guildmaster_companion|Why, Commander, there is one, and gladly shall I tell you of him; he is a gate guard, by the name of Cirdil, and even now I warrant you’ll find him at his rounds. He is dutiful and brave - but I spoke with him of late, and it seems to me he wishes to do more than simply stand his watch on the walls while the Shadow gathers beyond them. Surely he will be happy to venture out from the White City in your company.
; str_gondor_ha_guildmaster_companion| Indeed there are. High in the esteem of our Captain Faramir are two of our commanders, Mablung and Damrod. Damrod is away at our Captain’s behest; but Mablung may be found in the cave yonder, a little way along this path here. We Rangers know much of woodlore and archery; Mablung stands above many of us. He is a man of prowess, and accounted one of our finest. Mayhap he will be given leave to accompany you for a time.
; str_rohan_guildmaster_companion_player_ask|By leave of Theoden King, I seek the aid of valiant Rohirrim. Will any stout warriors here follow me?
; str_rohan_guildmaster_companion_none|It were better if you sought to bring aid, rather than asked for it. Horses, swords, spears - these things we need at present. As for your question: go to the barracks. There you will find those of our people willing to ride forth, such as they are - many beardless youths still, and still others unskilled herders and tenders of flocks.
; str_rohan_guildmaster_companion_player_none_ok|I do take thought for your people as well, Thain. Farewell.
; str_rohan_guildmaster_player_found_ok|That counsel seems good to me. Health be with thee at thy coming and going!
; str_rohan_edoras_guildmaster_companion|Indeed, there may be. Dark indeed must the days become before our women ride out to war alongside the menfolk - yet our fearless and high-hearted Lady Eowyn, whom all love, rides and fights as well as any Marshal. Some shieldmaidens have trained with her from childhood, and several may be found around the Golden Hall. Hardy indeed are our women! Seek one called Galmyne - she is skilled in many arts of war, and goes about like a mare chafing at an ill-fitting bridle, for she has not been given leave to ride out with the men.
; str_lorien_guildmaster_companion_player_ask|Elder, I seek aid. The least among the Elves of Lorien fight like heroes of old; will any here join my cause?
; str_lorien_guildmaster_companion_none|Evil has been seen and heard even here, among the mallorn-trees; sorrow has been known. In happier days we plucked the strings of harps; in these days we have indeed become skilled at the plucking of bowstrings. I cannot speak of heroes among us, but you should speak to the commander of our garrison here. Perhaps some few of our people may consent to join you for a time.
; str_lorien_guildmaster_companion_player_none_ok|I had hoped for fairer words in this fair land of yours. But it shall be as you say, Elder.
; str_lorien_guildmaster_player_found_ok|I thank you for your counsel, Elder. Tiro ven Elbereth!
; str_lorien_ca_guildmaster_companion|Nan Belain, here is a wonder indeed! At any other time I might have had naught but disappointment for you, but now in the company of the Lord and Lady of the Wood stands none other than the Lord Glorfindel, hero of more battles than even I can remember. I know little of such a great champion’s purpose here - he arrived with the host of Elrond, Lord of Imladris, and his own counsel he keeps, speaking only with Lord Celeborn and Lady Galadriel. Seek him out, Commander. Perhaps his cause may be joined to yours.
; str_beorn_guildmaster_companion_player_ask|Your advice, good fellow - are there any warriors of remarkable prowess here?
; str_beorn_guildmaster_companion_none|Well, I don’t know about that. Your question isn’t very clear. What kind of “remarkable prowess” do you want that you can’t find among our garrison, I ask you? We fight with stout staves and sharp hatchets, we shoot well enough with bows. I don’t know what more you could ask for.
; str_beorn_guildmaster_companion_player_none_ok|Well, then, I suppose I’d best be off. Good day to you, woodsman.
; str_beorn_guildmaster_player_found_ok|I see. Well, I shall look around for this “Dimborn”. Good day to you, woodsman.
; str_beorn_house_guildmaster_companion|Well, now, there’s a question. I’d say any of us could fight off a goblin or warg well enough, but our chief’s nephew is stouter than most. Spends most of his time just staring at trees, though. Or at nothing in particular. More thew than thought, if you take my meaning. Still, he’s gentle with his friends but fierce to his enemies, as one should be. Walks the woods as well as any Elf, I’d say. We call him Dimborn; not to be unkind, you understand, but we like calling things and people what they are. He ought to be around here somewhere.
; str_woodelf_guildmaster_companion_player_ask|By leave of Thranduil Elvenking, I seek champions of the Greenwood to fight in my command, Elder.
; str_woodelf_guildmaster_companion_none|Indeed? Then you may ask those of our garrison, and mayhap some will be willing to follow you. But I sense your desire runs deeper than that. Do you fancy yourself a great hero, like those from Nargothrond or Gondolin of old? Our finest warriors are needed to guard against the growing shadow in Mirkwood. Take with you what soldiers we can spare, and be content.
; str_woodelf_guildmaster_companion_player_none_ok|Very well, Elder. As you say.
; str_woodelf_guildmaster_player_found_ok|I thank you for your counsel, Elder. Navaer!
; str_woodelf_halls_guildmaster_companion|Indeed? There is one among us whose aid you should not despise. Luevanna is her name, and she is kin to me, as it happens. She is young, as our people reckon it, and has an abiding love for the woods and all the creatures in it, save those which are evil. Hers is a gentle spirit - she has not fought in our array. Still, I have a hope that she may be persuaded to follow you, for then she may come to learn that though we love peaceful ways in peaceful days, times of war call for warlike deeds. See, there she stands - you may speak with her. Harthon gerithach lend vaer!
; str_dale_guildmaster_companion_player_ask|Good master, I seek stout warriors of prowess to fight beside me in this war.
; str_dale_guildmaster_companion_none|Well, now. Here in our town, we have always plied our trades and managed our affairs quietly, and not until recently have we had a great need for fighting men. I suppose you might ask at our barracks, and find what recruits you can from our garrison. I know of none among our captains here who would abandon his post to follow you.
; str_dale_guildmaster_companion_player_none_ok|I will do that, good master. Farewell to you.
; str_dale_guildmaster_player_found_ok|Oft the unbidden gift proves the best value. I will speak to Faniul. Farewell!
; str_dale_main_guildmaster_companion|Well, the King and his Lords have the best claim on the service of good captains. I don’t know that any of great renown are left to follow you - but are mere fighting men all you need? What about binders of wounds, versed in herblore? I know of one such - Faniul, personal healer to the King. She was midwife to my sister - and do not look askance at her age: she is of stout heart and sturdier than she looks. I warrant she’ll bear up well under the strains of travel. Why, I think I see her taking her ease over there, in this courtyard.
; str_dwarf_guildmaster_companion_player_ask|Good master, there seem to be some valiant warriors here. Will any follow my company?
; str_dwarf_guildmaster_companion_none|Well, you’re not wrong, there, about our skill in battle, but aren’t our lads from our garrison here good enough for you? ; str_dwarf_guildmaster_companion_player_none_ok|You needn’t get so annoyed, good master, I was simply asking. Good day to you.
; str_dwarf_guildmaster_player_found_ok|That is excellent to hear, good master. Good day to you!
; str_dwarf_erebor_guildmaster_companion|Oh ho! It’s warriors you’re after, are you? Then I have just the Dwarf for you: look for one Kili Goldfinger. Quite good at story-telling, too, and he favours the cheerful sort of tale. Not the Great Chamber, either. The upper halls, perhaps - look for him there.
; str_rhun_guildmaster_companion_player_ask|I heard there were great warriors here. Where are they? Who are worthy to join me?
; str_rhun_guildmaster_companion_none|Not all our warriors here are blooded, but each of them is stronger and braver than any ten Dalishmen! Go and ask the arms master to see if he can spare any for you.
; str_rhun_guildmaster_companion_player_none_ok|I ask for great warriors, and you show me drinkers of mother’s milk. Pah!
; str_rhun_guildmaster_player_found_ok|That is good to hear. Finally - a warrior with spirit!
; str_rhun_maincamp_guildmaster_companion|Our greatest swordbearers and riders fight in the retinues of our warlords. But there is one who has found favour with none of our chiefs so far. Not because he is weak; far from it! He does not curb his tongue when he speaks, and he has spoken loudly against our chieftains, saying they are slow to act and over-cautious. If he had his way, I wager the countryside would be covered in flames by now. His name is Varfang, and he spends his hours training near the prisoner cages, not far from this tent.
; str_guldur_guildmaster_companion_player_ask|All I see here is a rabble of treacherous skulkers, more likely to run than fight. Where are your proper warriors?
; str_guldur_guildmaster_companion_none|O ho! What do we have here? A great captain, are you? I reckon your bark’s worse than your bite, and no mistake. Orders are orders: you draw your troops from our garrison here, and that’s that. Keep talking like that where they’ve got ears to hear, though, and someone will stick a knife in your back one of these days, see if they don’t.
; str_guldur_guildmaster_companion_player_none_ok|You’ll watch your words with me, if you know what’s good for you.
; str_guldur_guildmaster_player_found_ok|Scared witless by this woman, are you? I’ll go see if she’s all you make her out to be. This had better not be a waste of my time!
; str_guldur_main_guildmaster_companion|We’ve got stout lads aplenty, curse you. Ha… I know what you’re really after. Oh yes, indeed, I know just where you should go, Commander.
